TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit DataListItemCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable

Docs.summary: Represents the collection of objects in the control. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The DataListItemCollection class represents a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem> objects, which in turn represent the data items in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control. To programmatically retrieve <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem> objects from a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control, use one of the following methods:
- Use the indexer to get a single <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem> object from the collection, using array notation.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItemCollection.CopyTo%2A> method to copy the contents of the collection to a <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object, which can then be used to get items from the collection.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItemCollection.GetEnumerator%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName> interface, which can then be used to get items from the collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItemCollection.Count%2A> property specifies the total number of items in the collection and is commonly used to determine the upper bound of the collection.
## Examples The following example creates a data source in the form of a <xref:System.Data.DataView> control and binds it to a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control declared in markup. It then displays the contents of the underlying DataListItemCollection object on the page.
[!code-vb[DataListItemCollection#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_150_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[DataListItemCollection#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_150_1.aspx)]

Docs.param: A object that contains the items with which to initialize the collection.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItemCollection> class.

MemberSignature.Value: public void CopyTo (Array array, int index);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CopyTo(class System.Array array, int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: A zero-based <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object that receives the copied items from the collection.
The first position in the specified <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object to receive the copied contents.
Docs.summary: Copies all the items from this collection to the specified <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object, starting at the specified index in the <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to copy the contents of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItemCollection> collection into the specified <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object, starting at the specified index.
> [!NOTE] > The `array` parameter must be a zero-based <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object.

Docs.summary: Gets the number of objects in the collection.
Docs.value: The number of objects in the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the Count property to determine the number of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem> objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItemCollection> collection. The Count property is commonly used when iterating through the collection to determine the upper bound of the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName> interface that contains all objects in the .
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName> interface that contains all objects in the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to create a <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName> that can be easily iterated through to get each item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItemCollection> collection.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to get the item currently pointed to in the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move to the next item in the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move the enumerator back to the initial position.
> [!NOTE] > After you create a <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName> object or use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move the enumerator to the first item in the collection, you must call the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method. Otherwise, the item represented by the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is undefined.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the objects in the can be modified.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property always returns `false` to indicate that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItemCollection> can be written to in all cases.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether access to the is synchronized (thread-safe).

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is derived from the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> class and is overridden to always return `false`.
For more information on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection.IsSynchronized%2A> property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> interface.

Docs.param: The index of the in the collection to retrieve.
Docs.summary: Gets a object at the specified index in the collection.
Docs.value: A object in the collection at the specified index.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this indexer to get a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItem> object from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItemCollection> at the specified index using array notation.

Docs.summary: Gets the object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Object?displayProperty=fullName> that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The object returned in this implementation is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataListItemCollection> object itself.
For more information on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection.SyncRoot%2A> property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> interface.
